#bebulletproof of the Day:  When you experience a rejection separate the factors under your control from those outside of your control.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Remember that the tough time your going through now is probably temporary.
#bebulletproof of the Day:Always try to be an optimist when going through tough times.
#bebulletproof of the Day:Try to take an objective view to help you be realistic about a rejection or setback.
#bebulletproof of the Day: List all the evidence that supports your success and revisit them whenever you need a boost of confidence.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Whenever you are feeling low at work make an inventory of your successes and career achievements.
#bebulletproof of the Day:Whenever you feel rejection at work, write a letter to yourself, adding some perspective to the situation.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Find a mentor to help guide you through challenges. The person should symbolize being bulletproof.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Creat options whenever you feel trapped at work. Try to see all the choices you have.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Remind yourself that you prefer to get along with your boss, instead of worrying about it.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Always remember your boss is temporary. Your role or his role could change.
#bebulletproof of the Day:Veiwing your boss as a customer can help focus on achieving success and meeting expectations.
#bebulletproof of the Day: The bulletproof way around presenting to a tough audience is to create an ally in your audience.
#bebulletproof of the Day: By overstating a colleagues criticism or concern, you can encourage him to be reasonale and flexible.
#bebulletproof of the Day: If you've been criticised at work, turn the focus on the perpetrator of the undesirable behaviour.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Acknowledge the problem and show that you are aiming to fix it.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Making comparisons can help you put a challenging topic into context.
#bebulletproof of the Day: When giving bad news, change the focus of the conversation and share a whole scene behind the challenge.
#bebulletproof of the Day:Ask for specifics behind criticism, this gives you more information to help understand the disapproving  remark.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Ask yourself for the thought behind your co-workers question. Try not to leap straight to the answer.
#bebulletproof of the Day:Before responding to a question, reflect back the motivation behind it, to create a bond with the audience.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Breath and pause- When you have taken a few deep breaths, you will be calmer and your thinking will be clearer.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Be flexible instead of rigid- Rigid objects are fragile, while flexibility makes things stronger.
#bebulletproof of the Day:To be bulletproof remind yourself that nobody pays as much attention to your mistakes as you imagine.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Don’t try to read other people's minds, remind yourself that you do not know what other people are thinking.
#bebulletproof of the Day:Part of becoming bulletproof is learning to step outside yourself to manage your emotions calmly and effectively.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Simply be more aware of your thoughts and feelings.
#bebulletproof of the Day:To avoid depression and anxiety, recognize and acknowledge negative thoughts and then let go of them.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Step outside your thoughts and observe your feelings to further understand and influence them.
#bebulletproof of the Day: A situation might seem hard to tolerate, but bulletproof people try to see it as still possible to improve.
#bebulletproof of the Day: To find a solution to a problem you have to worry less and re-visit the issue after a while.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Is your physical posture showing confidence? Tell people you’re a leader by improving your body language.
How to spice up your speeches? Use images and visual metaphors
#bebulletproof of the Day: Resilience can be learnt - you can develop and strengthen it! Happy New Year!
#bebulletproof of the Day: Think like someone who is starting from zero - everything to gain, nothing to lose.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Feedback: some is useful, some is harmless and some is downright toxic.
#bebulletproof of the Day: The emotional impact of losing something is twice as great as that of gaining it.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Learn to re-focus your mind; focus on positive life incidents. This gives you inner strength in tough times.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Catastrophising is a common thinking trap that makes incidents hurt us more than they should.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Set yourself goals related to the effort & input you can control, not goals which are out of your hand.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Have the confidence to be vulnerable.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Focus on the positivies and not the negatives!
#bebulletproof of the Day: Keep making healthy choices about diet, exercise, and relaxation when under fire.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Don't criticise - or make assumptions about - the other person's disposition or character.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Don't get bogged down in the detail of a specific incident.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Think about what works and learn from it rather than what doesn't work.

#bebulletproof of the Day: Be clear about what you're asking for.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Ignore the ignoring - act ike the person you want to be treated as.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Disarm others with 'third-party' compliments.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Remind yourself: I prefer to be liked, but I'm okay if sometimes I'm not liked for a bit.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Start an honest-feedback conversation by setting out the context clearly.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Use 'interest-driven', not 'position-driven' language.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Ask a question to show that you're ready & willing to listen - keep it brief, broad & open.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Differentiate realistically between what you can affect and what you can't when it comes to achieving success.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Describe in factual and neutral terms.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Remind yourself that if you have made a mistake it doesn't mean you have blown everything.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Be objective and remind yourself that it won't last forever.
#bebulletproof of the Day: You can be respected and valued by the core group without ever trying to enter it.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Pick straight-talking conversations wisely.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Politics is mostly defensive. It is about people protecting their own interests.
#bebulletproof of the Day: The best way to achieve a big success is to get in the 'success habit'.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Social contact makes us stronger

#bebulletproof of the Day: Bosses aren't ultra virtuous or malevolent - they're actually fallible humans with all the usual insecurities.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Asking advice builds relationships; the advisor has an invested interest in your success.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Don't correct an inaccuracy during the heat of the moment - wait until emotions are more stable.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Make a personal reference wherever possible.
#bebulletproof of the Day: Don't waste time and energy on mind reading.
#bebulletproof of the Day: How we think about things affects the way we feel
